title: Creating a Diagram
text: There are a few ways to approach this problem. We need to divide the expression for the volume of the solid by the expressions for the length and width. Let us create a sketch.\n##figure1.gif##

title: Creating an Equation
text: We can now write an equation by substituting the known values into the formula for the volume of a rectangular solid. $$V=l w h$$. $$3x^4-3x^3-33x^2+54x=3x \left(x-2\right) h$$\n
speech: We can now write an equation by substituting the known values into the formula for the volume of a rectangular solid.    v is equal to l w h, .  3 x to the fourth minus 3 x cubed, minus 33 x squared, plus 54 x is equal to 3 x, parentheses x minus 2,  times h \n

.   3 x to the fourth minus 3 x cubed, minus 33 x squared, plus 54 x is equal to 3 x,  x minus 2,  times h

title: Solving for H
text: To solve for $$h$$, we can first divide both sides by $$3x$$. We now have $$(x-2)h=x^3-x^2-11x+18$$
speech: To solve for  h , we can first divide both sides by  3 x . We now have , parentheses x minus 2,  times h is equal to x cubed minus x squared minus 11 x plus 18

. We now have  ,  x minus 2,  times h is equal to x cubed minus x squared minus 11 x plus 18

title: Synthetic Division
text: We now solve for $$h$$ by using synthetic division as shown.\n##figure2.gif##
